Reviews.Title: Clear, Wi-Fi Network Amazing, Using Computer Speakers too!
Reviews.Author: C. Chan "clumpymold"
Reviews.Content: So this would be my first TV since before this century (my last TV had wood trim around it and it was huge!).  I've now had this TV for a few days now and I love it.  Granted the processing is a little slow, but I have everything I need for this TV.I was debating on getting cable set up for this as well as an HDMI cable to hook up my desktop and/or laptop to this TV.  Turns out, I don't need to do any of that.  With their AllShare feature, as long as my desktop and/or laptop are turned on and connected to the network (using AllShare installed on each device), I can access each device from my computer.  On top of that, I have the internet (Netflix, Amazon Prime, Youtube, etc.) and any files I can copy over to a flash/USB drive or an external USB drive!  Plus, I can even use a wireless mouse to make maneuvering much faster.I was also debating/looking around for a nice speaker setup for this TV as I couldn't figure out how to hook up my 5.1 computer speakers to this TV (my speakers are actually pretty nice for my room).  The TV only has a single 3.5mm jack coming OUT for the audio while my computer's subwoofer/receiver has three 3.5mm jacks going INTO it (one for "FRONT", one for "REAR", and one for "SUB").  So what I did was simply use an extension cord with two male 3.5mm headphone jacks and connected 1 female to 2 male splitter to that jack coming from the TV.  I connected ANOTHER 1 female to 2 male splitter to the splitter above to have essentially THREE 3.5mm male plugs coming from my TV.  I then connected these to my computer's subwoofer, turned it on, and voila!  Surround sound on a budget!  I can also use more splitters to keep my computer plugged into it and they all work together (except when they're both plugged in, the sound is lowered slightly).  All in all, it's great sound!My only gripe with this TV (aside from the semi-slow processing speed) is that I wish the remote had a keyboard on it.  Makes entering username and passwords a tad frustrating (which you really only have to do once you set up the TV) as well as searching on the internet.Oh, and if this TV would accept a USB Bluetooth adapter so I could use my bluetooth keyboard, that would be awesome as well.  But that's not that important as I hardly use my keyboard on this TV anyway.I've also read SO many complaints about the color issue on this TV.  Maybe it's just me, but I don't seem to think this is an issue at all.  I just select "Natural" or "Movie", depending on what looks "best" to me and I'm good.  No need to tinker with the other settings.  Maybe when I get more "advanced", I will.  But, for now, I think this TV is awesome!  I don't even use a mount as I just set this on my table that happens to be against the wall and it's perfect!  Plugged this thing in after installing the TV's stand and it worked great!I also paid $1430 from Crutchfield.com, shipped for this on 11/23/12 (Black Friday).  It was completely sold out on Amazon.com (which had it for $1400 shipped but I had to pay tax!  Now, it's around $1800+ for this TV.  Apparently, it's in high demand or something.  :/

Reviews.Author: DJM NV "Dan"
Reviews.Content: As described.  Picture is excellent.  Stand is ugly, need to cover it up with something - why couldn't they add a decent mounting stand for this excellent TV? Reviews.Author: Oil Boiler
Reviews.Content: This is for all of you who tried to navigate the web browser with the supplied remote. Exercise in futility. I picked up the LogiTech K400 wireless keyboard on sale at Wmart for $25. It connects flawlessly and makes the built in browser usable, although still a little clunky. The K400 has a built in touch pad so you don't need a separate mouse. The 2 USB antennas piggyback together into one port. The picture is great with this TV and is 5 stars.  The set got 4 stars for the choppy web interface. I'll be back with a better review once I get some run time.  But for now, I'd rate it a "buy".  Got it at S*ms for $968.

Reviews.Title: SAMSUNG, LIKE AMAZON, BEST FOR THE MONEY
Reviews.Author: Retired in Moosic
Reviews.Content: My 6 year old 42" Samsung DLP began costing to much for repairs, projection lamps, color wheel, and lastly, power supply.  I just couldn't justify putting any mor $$$ into the set.  It worked great only for 5 years.  I vowed I'd never buy another Samsung.  I expected longer life from the TV.QVC has a special on an Element Electronics LED LCD 46" HD TV for under a grand.  Maybe you saw it.  What a piece of crap that set was.  It arrived with a defect in the screen.  A few of the pixels were dead, right in the viewing area.  And the sound was horrible!  It sounded like a 50's transitor radio in a shoe box, tinney and harsh. Trying all the variations for sound quality, and not finding any, I returned the TV.  Next I bought a Vizio. BIG mistake.I looked at other flat panels in stores and at friend's houses and wasn't impressed. Back to Samsung I went. I am not disappointed.  It is truly a great TV with sound quality similar to that of the old cabinet TVs.  The picture is extra sharp and there's no "judder" even tho the refresh rate is only 120. The Vizio and Sony sets that i saw had 60 refresh rates and the judder was well pronounced during fast action sports, Nascar, hockey.I know I'm eating crow regarding never buying another Samsung, but... this crow is delicious.And hats off to Amazon for offering the TV at a great price and fast delivery.I don't shop local markets.  I do most all shopping on-line. I always check the usual outlets but find myself coming back to Amazon for the best price, delivery and customer service.  I don't know why I look elsewhere.Buy this TV.  You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Smart Hub is worthless
Reviews.Author: mbs
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV because the picture looked like the best one in the store and it still looks great at home.  But if you are interested in using it for watching Netflix, Hulu+ etc. move on because this TV isn't going to cut it.The main problem is that it can't connect wirelessly most of the time and when it does it can't stay connected.  No other device in my home has any trouble connecting or staying connected to my wireless router or the internet.  I've updated the firmware and the apps, changed routers and checked every setting all of which did little or nothing.  It also doesn't remember the security setting of routers it has connected to so you have to re-enter it everytime it disconnects.  At this point, I've given up on entering pass codes and fiddling with it every time I want to watch something on Netflix or Hulu+.Another problem is that when the TV is actually able to connect to the internet, a lot of time it still can't connect to Netflix because whatever portal Samsung has set up, of which all the data is funneled through for some reason, is down for one reason or another.  In the month and half I've owned the TV this has happened at least 4 times.  So even if you decide to connect the TV to the internet via a cable this is a problem your likely face when using Smart Hub.Even though I'm disappointed with the Smart Hub, I'll keep the TV due to the amazing picture quality.  My blue-ray player can connect to Netflix, Hulu or whatever anyways.  Maybe one day Samsung will fix the software but I doubt it.So if the only thing your interested in is picture quality then this TV might be a good choice.  But the Smart Hub feature should be taken completely out of the equation when comparing it to other models/brands.

Reviews.Title: Good TV, tweaks may be needed, mounting options stink
Reviews.Author: bbilt
Reviews.Content: replaced my samsung led 2011 55" LED tv (un55d6050) with this tv. Having both TV's I will offer my thoughts between 2011 and 2012 models.Here goes: unpacked the TV, proceeded to hang it on the wall...and...it won't go on any of the two mounts I currently have mounted on the wall. Neither the ultraslim (samsung like) cable picture frame mount, nor an ultra slim wall mount made with steel plate and mounts etc. WHY YOU ASK? Well, Samsung changed the ES from the D ports, and made them come directly out the back, not tucked away, not streamlined, not anything. just like a cheap TV I suppose. this means when you connect an ethernet or coax antenna, you better be ready to dig a hole in your wall to make the tv flat. Yes, it sticks out and won't allow a ultra slim mount otherwise. seriously.  I CONSIDER THIS A STEP BACKWARDS. also note I didn't see near as many HDMI ports in the back. like 1, maybe 2 max. where did they go???? the un55d6050 had several and they were all slim lined and mounted to the current mounting system well.The Tv does come with a cool star mount for table mounting. and I do LOVE the new remote and smart hub. its much snappier and i have to say very nice. i use my android phone when searching the web (smart view app), and it works flawlessly. definitely awesome. the standard remote works well. the smart hub is much faster than the 2011 model. internet is quick. plan on getting a phone app if you use the internet browser. the only way it will work great with navigation.Picture compared to D series? Well, initially I hung the TV, and turned it on while installing a new RCA antenna. picture stunk. red people everywhere. colors were aweful and it was blury. played with settings for 4 days then considered maybe the antenna is the problem. yes it was. changed antennas and picture is indeed good again. very nice and sharp. whew. no idea why an antenna causes red colors.Smart hub water background is cool. and the thin bezel is a nice addition over the D series. the Wireless Built in worked flawlessly. great job. allshare works great as well. very handy.Picture isn't really an improvement over the 2011 model, but the other things i mentioned definitely are. One problem i noticed was Amazon instant video doesn't work on the browser. will not play movies. seriously its 2012. good grief. I blame Amazon but who knows.youtube works wonderfully though! not sure i would upgrade for the price difference. but i do like the new smart hub and remote much better. more responsive. quicker. no lag. don't use hulu or netflix so i cant comment.very happy with the TV, had a scare with the picture quality but got it right.

Reviews.Title: Love this Smart TV
Reviews.Author: bwalt
Reviews.Content: I have had the Samsung 46 inch Smart TV (Samsung UN46ES6100) for a few months and absolutely love it.  The important "wins" for me from the tv include:- 3 HMDI ports- Crystal Clear picture- Pretty darn good sound out of the box (I have a large living room and feel no need for surround sound or even a sound bar, although I will probably get one anyways)- The last big win for me is the actual smart function, which I noticed a lot of viewers had negatives on.  Now I can only really talk about what I use it for - streaming amazon rented movies and free stuff through prime - but I use it all the time.  Hooking the tv up to my wireless was a breeze and connecting to my amazon account was also extremely easy.  In no time I had the options of 1000s of shows and movies at my finger-tips, and as long as your internet isn't completely awful - renting in HD from amazon is nice too.Overall - Love the TV - by no means am I an expert in home entertainment, but for your average person who enjoys watching tv and movies - There is nothing better for the money as long as you have high speed internet or wifi that you can connect your tv too (and have netflix or amazon prime)

Reviews.Title: Difficult for Wall Mounting
Reviews.Author: cs
Reviews.Content: For some reason, probably to save a few pennies, Samsung decided to abandon the recessed / parallel to the wall connectors ... the power, primary HDMI, cable and TosLink point straight back and not only interfere with the wall, but also with many of the wall mount systems out there since they placed them too far up on the back panel. This is completely retarded.I had to purchase right-angle adapters for the above and that requires some care to get quality parts as opposed to junk. Also had to modify (RE. cut out) some of the sheet metal in my existing wall mount ... trying a new wall mount as well.Be advised to plan your wall installation for this deficient back-panel design by procuring the appropriate hardware in advance.That being said, the TV performance itself is outstanding, but Samsung really blew it on the mechanical design ... hence the two stars for the unnecessary installation grief.

USB style.Logitech  makes a K 400 model that  is compatible with this TV from what other reviewers have said.update I can Confirm that it DOES WORK WITH THIS TV!!. I do not believe any of the negative reviews that I've seen about this TV!!! Like the complaint about the TV base not being sturdy enough. which is absolutely not true in any way! the base is actually very easy to install if you're not completely stupid!! It's just one more thing that I love about this TV!!and the stand swivels.I am a very very very picky person when it comes to my TV or other electronics!!! another nice feature of this TV is most components that are connected to this TV can be turned off or turned on by just one button. the power button for the TV itself.. if the component you are using has some type of link feature. like sharp and Sony does or Samsung.. then you can even control more features with just the tv remote!! I have a Magnavox DVR HDD RECORDER HOOKED UP TO THIS TV.. So I can control my DVR with the TV remote now!! buy this TV it will probably be the last one you will buy for a very long time!! ALSO PS3 gameing is Amazing on this TV Just turn the TV to game mode in the settings and the picture Quality unbelievable no video lag at all zero lag I can't say enough good things about this TV!!! I ordered this TV through Amazon from the seller bits and pixels.. Great unbelievable customer service!!! a very nice lady named Beth help me with this TV purchase.. always email me when I had a question within like 20 minutes!! She personally made sure that the TV got to me in one piece!! very very fast shipping!! and unbelievable customer service !! she went above and beyond the call for me!!! thanks again Beth.!!  ALL I KNOW IS NOBODY TOUCHES SAMSUNG NOBODY!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV

Reviews.Content: I have no idea why but this TV works better than my Sony for streaming Netflix.  Perhaps it has a better hard drive or processor but it just streams much better. Reviews.Title: Recommended buy
Reviews.Author: Tony Thong
Reviews.Content: I've owned this tv for over 2 years and it is still kicking.  I've only had 1 problem with it connecting to the Samsung servers but other than that the tv is awesome.  The smart tv feature is the best thing about it.  I don't have cable and using this to watch netflix, youtube, hulu, etc without having to buy a standalone unit is great.  The picture quality is good; however, the sound is not so good (sometimes I have to pump the volume up to 60-70).  Other than that, I love this tv.

Reviews.Title: Mom loves it!
Reviews.Author: Mr. Meow
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my mom (she's 57 for reference), and she's thrilled. It's huge, and the picture quality is great. But what she really wanted was the internet integration. She's not super tech-savvy (don't get me wrong, she can do basic stuff on most electronics; she's not computer illiterate or anything), and having to switch inputs on the television and work different devices and remotes to use the internet was just too much. She'd just given up on watching Netflix, and she'd sometimes have to call me if she got stuck between devices. This makes it SO much easier. You push one button, and the app center comes up. The apps are fairly easy to navigate. She did need help with the initial set-up on some apps (like Netflix, you have to enter in your account information and such), but once that was done, she could handle it by herself with no problem and without having to switch remotes. Very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Amazing picture, can be glitchy and freeze sometimes though
Reviews.Author: Freemanh1983
Reviews.Content: Awesome tv, I love all the apps and how easy it is to stream from all the devices in the house, it sets everything up by itself.  I can stream movies from my laptop to my tv and the laptop is in the other room.  No more cables to hook up when I want to play something from the computer.  It can freeze up every once in a while.  Some times it will catch up and correct it self, other times it will have to be restarted.  I have to restart the tv at least once a week, thats why I gave only four stars.

Overall, it's a good product.

Reviews.Title: It's like a 46" Galaxy S4 !!!
Reviews.Author: Rubab Khan
Reviews.Content: I had very high expectation before the units arrived, but it easily met and beat all my expectations easily.First, the packaging was great. The usual TV box was put in a much lager brown box and packed very carefully and with a lot of protection. Not a scratch anywhere inside.Next, setting up was quick and easy. After connecting to the net, the TV took about half an hour to update everything, and I had to access most of teh features in Smart Hub one at a time to update everything, but that's okay. It is not much different than first time turning on a laptop or Smart phone.Then, it paired without any complaints with both my HTC one and my wife's S4 without any complaint. In fact, my friend brought over an iPhone just to see if Apple plays well with Samsung here, and it did! All you have to do is to search for "Samsung smart" in any app store for all the great free apps.Finally, cough up a few bucks for a  few extra apps, and your world will become perfect.BTW, although getting a wireless keyboard may seem like a good idea, since the on screen keyboard is annoying, you shouldn't bother about that if you have a smart phone.=====Verdict:Best smart TV and Best value. Perfect.
