Reviews.Title: Decent Price, Nice Features
Reviews.Author: Michael Bruns
Reviews.Content: First off, I will say that I got this TV at a great price, but I am somewhat distraught over its 'features'. I bought this TV for 3 reasons; it's big, it's slim, and it's 'smart'. It delivers on the first 2, but not so much on the last one. The apps for the TV are all unpolished, some work horridly. I want to touch on a few things that have caused me to lower my rating of this TV, and anything unmentioned could be considered to work anywhere from OK to great:YouTube:YouTube doesn't even allow you to use a keyboard to search for videos. The input for it is extremely cumbersome, and playback is terrible. I was trying to watch a video today that would just not let me enjoy it. It would freeze every few minutes, but not due to buffering... it would either cut audio or video. I hoped it was simply a buffering issue, but I let it sit for over 10 minutes, and 20 seconds later into the video, the same thing occurred. Our internet is decently fast, and I am able to load the same video from any of our PCs as well as my phone and tablet with no issues. The playlist feature is broken, it doesn't even put the videos in order (I'm watching a video series on a video game, so kind of important that it be in order). There's tons missing from it.Browser:Extremely limited capability. I again have better luck from a smartphone loading a page. Trying to load a flash video (which is supposedly supported) of a live stream, it struggled at first but eventually started the stream. It crashed when I tried to make it fullscreen, and every time after, it would crash when simply trying to load the page.AllShare:IS A JOKE! I've never once gotten it to work. It sees my computer, but I can't find anything on it. Instead I use PS3 Media Server to accomplish the task of streaming from my PC to my TV. Big fail Samsung, this, among other things has made me lose faith in your products. At least TVs anyway. Though my Galaxy S3 is unable to control the TV through the AllShare app they offer because it supposedly doesn't contain Samsung framework, which is frankly a load of BS. I have yet another 3rd party app that does the job no problem.The TV has frozen on me multiple times to the point where I couldn't even turn it off. I had to either wait for it to shut itself down, or pull the plug. I've owned the TV for about 6 months, and I would say this has happened close to a dozen times. I was not doing anything other than trying to access or close out of the SmartTV functions.Overall, I would say that, as a TV, it does the job. It has a beautiful display and everything looks great on it - movies, games, and TV. But as far as the 'Smart' functions go, don't buy this for that. It's still too dumb to be worth it.

Reviews.Title: Good TV, Lousy Smart apps
Reviews.Author: Van E. Wehrle "netShark"
Reviews.Content: I should have bought this tv from Amazon instead of Sears. At the time I figured a big purchase would be better from a brick and mortar store in case I have to return it. When it arrived the first thing I noticed was the giant notice on the front of the box that says "Do Not Return To Store". I dont have a reason to return it, but was just trying to shop smart. (Not to dig too much on Sears but the blue ray player I bought at the same time wasnt in stock but they charged my card anyway and it took 4 phone calls and 3 months to get my money back)As for the UN46ES6100 46" Smart TV itself, it has a remarkable picture once the settings are changed and the auto-lighting feature is turned off.  It's the kind of quality picture I was hoping for. Vibrant, clear, blacks are rich, and I havent noticed and light bleed or ghosting or anything like that.The "smart tv" features are poorly designed and it's a major hassle to use the remote to arrow across the on screen virtual keyboard when web browsing.  I bought a logitech K400 wireless keyboard w/touchpad and it works great - when Im in the smart hub or web browser - but that's it.  Once I launch any of the apps like Netflix the keyboard instantly stops working.  Samsung makes a their own expensive keyboard to work with their smart tv's but it doesnt work with the preinstalled apps either. This is a major downside because Samsung partners with Netflix and uses them as one of their biggest smart-tv features.They point their fingers at Netflix, and Netflix blames Samsung and neither company responds in a helpful manner.  Also the Netflix app is oversized and I can only see two movie thumbs at a time, trying to adjust the resolution of the tv once in side the app is useless, the tv picture options become all grayed out. Samsung approves these apps and uses them as a selling point but wont take any responsibility for them not working correctly. Netflix simply blames Samsung.  So, the smart tv apps are 90% worthless and but I do have a nice TV but cannot call it a good "Smart" Tv.I ended up working around these problems by connecting my Asus Gaming Laptop to the tv so I can watch netflix at the correct screen size and use the wireless keyboard/mouse. Thus the smart tv feature is utterly useless and disappointing.  Again, the tv picture quality itself is great though.All in all there is no point in getting this smart tv from samsung unless you dont mind fumbling around on the "on screen virtual keyboard" using their remote control - arrowing across the thing one key at a time.

Reviews.Title: Superb picture, Smart TV function is a bit buggy
Reviews.Author: Tech-Guru
Reviews.Content: I love the slim design and the crystal-clear picture of this TV. I would have given it 5 stars if it wasn't for the premium price for the Smart TV feature, which I had a lot of problems with and had to frequently reload the firmware. I also couldn't get the iPhone app to work 100% correctly with it, thus the 4-star rating.

Reviews.Title: OUTSTANDING TV FOR PRICE
Reviews.Author: Eric Roberts
Reviews.Content: I was expecting it to be a nice tv, but amazing is more like it. I replaced a 240 hz LG LCD with this TV and watched Lord of the Rings The two towers and you can't tell a difference during the action scenes.  Delivery was a breeze! Guy came in unboxed ensured it was working and took away all wrapping.  I have a Samsung  laptop and Galaxy siii smart phone and with "all share" can share content quickly among the 3. The only downside is awkward remote use as a keyboard with the browser.

Reviews.Title: Good TV for the Price
Reviews.Author: TV Guy
Reviews.Content: Got this TV on sale when it was $1499 (the cheapest it seems to go down) and I've been very happy with it.The "Smart" functions are user-friendly and respond quickly and the TV has a very sleek, thin design. I bought the this Smart TV version because I read better reviews than its "Dumb TV" equivalent but I find myself using the features all the time. Streaming Netflix and HBO go without using my Xbox is awesome.The video quality is great as !!!***as long as the source of the video is good***!!! Some channels have stronger HD than others and that's where I think the criticism comes from. Channels like AMC, ESPN, HBO, etc look fantastic. Something on your local CW may not look as good.As mentioned by many others, the biggest issue with this TV is the sound. You've really got to crank up the volume to get decent audio in the room. I plan to buy a sound bar, which will hopefully solve this.If you're looking for a somewhat cheap HD TV and don't care about 3D, this is a good buy.

Reviews.Title: Good choice for the bedroom
Reviews.Author: Babs
Reviews.Content: It is a great TV.  I had a little bit of an issue with the picture at the beginning but once we put the controls on auto (brightness, contract, etc.) it seemed much better.  The only complaint I have is that for a 60 inch TV, I think the pedistal holding it should be much sturdier in order to keep it completely secure.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV
Reviews.Author: RDC
Reviews.Content: We have had this TV for over a month and am very impressed with the quality of the picture and sound.  The TV itself is the thinest TV I have ever seen.  Looks great mounted on the wall.  We have not used any of the "smart" functions of it, not sure if we will...but we are loving this TV.

Reviews.Title: Nice Flat Screen
Reviews.Author: Ellie
Reviews.Content: We bought this after buying the similar set in 3D...great picture and easy to navigate & use all the features it offers!

Reviews.Title: Excellent LED HDTV for the price.
Reviews.Author: Ferenc Szepfalusy
Reviews.Content: This TV has all the features I was looking for.  The quality of the picture is outstanding.  The price is unbeatable.  Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Very happy, 4.49 stars overall
Reviews.Author: Peter
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for 4 months. Before I got it, I watched movies on a 27" Samsung CRT (top-of-the-line picture quality for the era) and played Xbox 360 games on a 22" Acer LCD. This, of course, blows both of those out of the water. I now use it full-time when I'm computing from the couch - great for casual surfing, but a little hard to read multiple paragraphs. The picture is amazing compared to both of my previous setups. I had issues with contrast on super-dark things (especially in games) on the Acer LCD and I haven't noticed it one bit on the Samsung. Black objects show up black instead of a weirdly-glowing gray.My minor gripes with it are the sound quality and the "smart" features. For sound, my old CRT TV was much better with an array of forward-facing speakers.  Front-facing speakers might take away from the sleek look of this TV. This TV has 2 downward-facing drivers. They're okay, I turn on the home theater speakers for anything serious. Stereo separation can still be heard from the couch, though.I tried using the Smart TV stuff, but found myself always putting down the slow-responding remote and switching back to the computer input. I had a dedicated network cable for the TV for a time, but then decided it would be better used for my printer. The features might replace the need for something like a Roku, but being able to switch quickly from media players like VLC for videos, Winamp for music, and watching videos off the web makes it so much easier to just do it from a PC. If you don't already have an extra computer, you might have to factor this into the price of your setup, though.The 1/8" stereo in made a ground loop (humming) if my cable box was plugged in. I rarely watch actual TV, so I just left it unplugged for a while. I got an optical audio cable for my setup only to find that there's no optical-in on this TV. Then I discovered you can do audio out on the GeForce GTX 465 through a DVI to HDMI cable, so the problem was solved.

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: biker09999
Reviews.Content: I have a had since dec 2012 and it works great. I like that I got this version with smart TV. I use it for netfllx adn amazon prime

Reviews.Title: TV is great but stand is defective
Reviews.Author: busy_doc
Reviews.Content: The TV works great but the stand provided by Samsung makes the TV tilt downward to the right.  Since the TV isn't level, the picture doesn't look level either.  The stand for this TV is seriously flawed in design.  I had to place a box at the bottom right corner of the TV to make the TV and the picture level. This is incredible!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Jim Werbaneth
Reviews.Content: I bought this for the game room in my new house, and it is a great TV.  I have another Samsung flatscreen, a much smaller one in the master bedroom, and have been satisfied with it.  But this is an even better product.  Now all I need to do is hook it up to the stereo.

Reviews.Title: The smart tv does more than I expected it would.
Reviews.Author: james mietz
Reviews.Content: The picture is excellent, the smart tv works well, the audio needs improvement.  I have it hooked in with my BOSE radio, so that helps to improve the sound.

Reviews.Title: Lovely product...what more can I say?
Reviews.Author: Dina
Reviews.Content: We knew we wanted a Samsung.  My husband has the same brand computer monitor.  Just lovely.  You will be thankful you purchased the bigger screen.  Just do it!

Reviews.Title: Samsung 55-inch 1080p Slim LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: Ormond L Fortier
Reviews.Content: Already had a Samsung 46" and wanted to move up.  This upgrade increased my viewing area by 43%.  Sharp, clear, and Smart-tv capability allows easy access to Netflix and others plus many other features I haven't explored yet.  A great TV. The 55" has an upgraded version with 3D capability; those who are gamers or with kids might enjoy this feature for a few dollars more.

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: V. Camozzi
Reviews.Content: I purchased this about a month ago. So far it was an easy set up, the picture is clear and my husband loves the sports picture set up. It has Netflix and Hulu Plus access to stream directly, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!
Reviews.Author: chris boudreau
Reviews.Content: Beautiful quality. Thought I noticed some clouding at first, but it was just the fact that my paused screen still has faint outlines that my old TV didn't register when it did and looked black. Great overall!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: JW
Reviews.Content: Just short of 5 stars because the TV apps do tend to freeze up once in a while and TV has to be restarted. Other than that TV picture is great and very useful!

Reviews.Title: If at first you don't succeed ...
Reviews.Author: Shopper7 "JLM"
Reviews.Content: LOVE this TV! And Amazon customer service is the best.  The TV was damaged during shipment which I didn't discover until setting it up however CS replaced it without a problem and I had my new, undamaged TV within days.  The TV itself is slim and fits nicely into the room.  The apps are great - I've logged into all my accounts and listen to Pandora, rent movies through Netflix, plus can access the Internet through wireless.  Oh and of course there's using it as a normal TV.  The picture quality's crisp and you're able to customize the settings to whatever works best for you.  I was also very happy with the deal I got right before the holiday season.

Reviews.Title: AAA+++
Reviews.Author: Richard Sachs "Wickynj"
Reviews.Content: Another excellent product from Samsung, consumer friendly setup.  Spectacular HD picture;  you can see every line and wrinke on peoples faces!

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Quality4Me
Reviews.Content: TV picture is excellent. Low power consumption for such a large screeen is amazing, and very sharp. LED colors are very good, although my prior 46" Samsung LCD was slightly warmer colors that I did like. Excellent connections in back. Much lighter weight. Smaller boarders around the TV made it not look imposing. "Smart TV" lacks sufficient buffering for HD U-Tube. I got a new standard 3.0 modem and it boosted my speed from 4 MBPS to 13 MBPS with TWC "standard". I think that helped, but there was still some buffering on HD U-Tube. Standard format in U-Tube was fine with no buffering and we watched a full old movie with no interruptions. I tested the same HD U-Tube program through my computer and connect it to the TV with no buffering at all so that is an alternative work around . Overall I am very happy and glad I got it, and would give 5 stars if not for the Smart features being a little less than anticipated. P.S. Remote is awkward for typing in searches.  Weather on old Samsung could be pulled up while still watching TV but leaves broadcaset on the new set. I also wish something other than MSN was the default web home page since typing is hard to go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: Samsung smart tv
Reviews.Author: Richard A Mello
Reviews.Content: If the damn tv was so smart, you should plug it in and it works! Maybe I'm old-school, but the picture and audio, which was a concern, is very good.

Reviews.Title: Great TV- with caveats
Reviews.Author: HCPro
Reviews.Content: I replaced my bedroom Samsung 2004 projection TV with this one. Both are 46" screens. The old TV was getting a bit faded and the HDMI connector was becoming loose which caused video noise problems (even though I used component RGB). No surprisingly, the differences we striking. I also have a Samsung 58" Plasma and Blue-Ray DVD player in the living room. So far, I judge the new bedroom TV to be superior to the plasma but I am using component connections for the plasma and, based on what I'm seeing with the HDMI (cable box) connection I thibnk I'll try that for the plasma too.Set up was relatively simple. WPS worked properly. Though the included owners guide is thorough, it is written by a non-English speaker and that makes it an exercise is encryption. Regardless, I got the TV to up what I assume was some kind of firmware (the on-screen message didn't define it) and add many Smart TV Apps. I also downloaded the ALLshare software to my PC. That was not a good experience and despite opting out of it, it added some kind of toolbar that overrode all my preferences for a home page in favor of some kind of (White Snake??)Search engine. That allowed me to use Allshare which, BTW, still is awful. Also, as many here have already said the pick and peck on-screen keyboard is a slow, frustrating means of character entry. That hasn't changed in years!!! I have not tried to program the remote so it operates my cable box but I was able to get my cable box remote to turn the TV on and off. I suspect this won't be a straight-forward process as my cable box isn't listed on their code list. I have a few wireless keyboard systems sitting around so I'll try to use one of them but I also know I have a better chance of winning the lottery than getting one to work with the TV. Samsung just doesn't get how angry many of its customers are about this. It needs to be addressed and done so it is backwardly compatible. I've only had the TV 1 day so more to come as it develops.

Reviews.Title: Awesome tv
Reviews.Author: Noelle
Reviews.Content: This TV is amazing. Easy to assemble and use. Light weight. Beautiful picture. Would highly recommend. Well worth it and the shipping was supper fast and free!! Amazon was the easy shopping experience I have ever had!! I am hooked!!and they beat every price out there!!

Reviews.Title: A real nice TV!!
Reviews.Author: smokey
Reviews.Content: A real nice TV!! A good buy for all the bells and whistles it has. The picture is great .

Reviews.Title: Good So far, but Smart TV operation could be painful
Reviews.Author: Robin
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is best out there in market, very happy!! It was easy to setup and very light weight.Pros:Picture qualityEasy setupiPhone app for remoteTV Stand rotate easily in case u want to frequently changeCons:I wish they had provided wireless remote pad for smart tvNot the best sound - need to get external sound barHappy with the with the purchase and price is good for features.As always amazon service is excellent!!

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: I really like my new tv has anything I could have asked for and the only thing I regret was not just spending the extra money to get the one with 3D also.

Reviews.Title: New Samsung
Reviews.Author: Tod Hildebrand "TAH"
Reviews.Content: Very light and as the name implies - very slim.  Great picture quality.  Can't really comment on the sound quality as I have it set up on a Harman Kardon AVR.  Easy to unbox and set-up. Highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: dnice
Reviews.Content: Great TV for a great price. Lightweight, easy to install. Perfect for my living room which is very bright during the day. Plus free delivery.

Reviews.Title: Great LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Dimaggio "Mike D."
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints. This is a great HDTV and the picture is crystal clear. My favorite aspect of the TV is the swivel base.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Patti Allen
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is amazing! Navigation through all the different features is so easy! I would definitely purchase a Samsung TV again!

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN46ES6100
Reviews.Author: Wayne
Reviews.Content: I have received this television on time and it has been working well thus far. The colors are very beautiful and I am very impressed with it so far.

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: Madhoshi
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV set for those not wanting to spend a ton of money and still get a great picture. It's very economical and I am extremely please with it's performance. The picture is vivid and lifelike, with minimal if any ghosting or shadowing when I'm watching fast paced action movies or sports. All in all great tv!!

Reviews.Title: This is a great TV.
Reviews.Author: Linda Bell Brighton "Magic, Myth, Monsters"
Reviews.Content: It was easy to set both physically & programming. You can see a great picture from any animal.And Samsung support is great, Americans in America (Utah) answering your questions & walking you through.

Reviews.Title: samsung un55es6100
Reviews.Author: donald wicks
Reviews.Content: this tv is the greatest tv that i have ever purchased. it's not my first samsung and certainly not my last

Reviews.Title: Excellent Upgrade
Reviews.Author: Brandon Piper
Reviews.Content: I upgraded to this from a 40" LCD. My old tv was one of the original flatscreens that came out back in the day. I use mine as a monitor for my computer so all the apps are nice but i dont use them much. The picture is excellent. The TV itself is extremely light and thin. I've read reviews about how the apps take forever to load, i dont buy in to that crap. They load just fine, especially when compared to a Vizio's slow app processing power. Overall i would definitely buy this tv again and have suggested it to everyone i know in the market for a new tv. i paid 650 for mine so it was an excellent deal, especially since they range from 750+ during non seasonal sales.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Picture, Decent Amount of Applications
Reviews.Author: Michael J Pratico Jr
Reviews.Content: A smart tv is absolutely they way to go.  It goes well beyond a web browser and includes applications much like your android or iPhone.  The WiFi access also allows for updating the TV's software.  The picture is incredible.

Reviews.Title: Great picture but screen flawed around edges
Reviews.Author: brute
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up. Great picture and color quality. Only problem is the screen has a random dark pattern along the top and right side, like it pulled apart. Will be exchanging for another.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: AMANDA L DELGADO
Reviews.Content: Got it for a little over a grand, awesome tv couldn't be happier. Really dig the sleekness and for the most part the features are pretty interesting

Reviews.Title: Great TV - Not so smart
Reviews.Author: R. Bennett
Reviews.Content: Great picture, sound quality is amazing, remote control is not that ergonomically efficient, and SMART TV, not so much.  i have several devices that are connected wirelessly, yet the TV will connect then 3 minutes later disconnect.  My techy buddy couldn't even figure it out.  when it is connected,' typing' is difficult at best.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LED
Reviews.Author: Sony Gala
Reviews.Content: Love the Smart TV. Looked smaller than my previous Samsung model because of the sleeker look.  Only downside is the shaky stand. You could by a separate kit to tie the tv down to the stand.

Reviews.Title: WORTH EVERY PENNY PURCHASED
Reviews.Author: henry perez paz
Reviews.Content: light streamline crisp colors and viewing ample space able to see many details not afforded with smaller screens MY CHRISTMAS PRESENT HAPPY NEW YEARS

Reviews.Title: Great TV for $800
Reviews.Author: bjwitz3
Reviews.Content: My brother in law bought this TV a couple months ago and I saw it at Thanksgiving and said WOW - my wife asked if we could get one.  First big order through Amazon and it arrived in a few days after the order.  TV is awesome.  Stream Netflix daily with NO / ZERO issues (I have TimeWarner high speed and a high end Cisco router).  My wife likes the built in yoga sessions.  The quality is so good it almost looks 3D without it being 3D.  It puts my 42" LCD (that is about 3 years old) to shame.

Reviews.Title: Crippled without ability to use a keyboard and mouse
Reviews.Author: N. T. Enloe
Reviews.Content: The image quality is great and the TV is very slim. One of the speakers gets really buzzy even at a relatively low volume though. Sent a service request to Samsung over a month ago and never heard back. I thought that I would be able to add a wireless keyboard and mouse to this TV but alas they are not supported. Using the web browser is useless without them. Doing any sort of typing using the remote is futile. It is nice that there are keyboard apps for your iphone/ipad that connect to the tv but they are not that reliable. I would love to see the Amazon Instant Video app made available to this TV. It's available for older Samsung Smart tvs. Every once in a while the TV just shuts itself off and can't be turned on again for a few minutes. Contacted Samsung about this as well but never heard back.

Reviews.Title: I love the TV!
Reviews.Author: EDH "EDH"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV after a lot of research and thought.  I am thrilled.  I'm not a techy...just a regular person who went from a TV I bought about 8 years ago to this one.  Love the picture, the sound is great.  I love that I can watch Hulu on it.  The only problem I have is that I can't figure out how to plug in a wireless keyboard.  I have a logitech LX 710 and have no idea if I am plugging it in wrong or if it is not compatible.  If any one has any advice for me, I would love to hear it!  Maybe I don't know where to plug it in?  If there is a special place, please let me know.Thanks so much!

Reviews.Title: great tv, great price
Reviews.Author: joekonet
Reviews.Content: no tax + free shipping? absolutely. don't forget to grab the Samsung WMN250M Mini Wall-Mount to hang this on the wall. quality, online content, streaming media capabilities are excellent.

Reviews.Title: I'm having a lot of problems
Reviews.Author: T. Gluck "tgny"
Reviews.Content: This TV was very highly rated, which is why we selected it.  But I am having a number of problems with it:1) It takes an EXCESSIVELY long time for the TV to respond to the remote.  E.g., when I want to change the channel, or look at the guide, or go to On Demand - it takes much longer than it should.  Very frustrating.2) More serious:  I can't get my Netflix streaming (which I am PAYING FOR!) or Amazon video store because the TV has a 'bug.' I only learned this when I called Samsung to find out why I wasn't seeing these options.3) The TV had a bug - but the company didn't contact its customers!  For weeks I was spending hours trying to fix what I thought was MY problem!  Terrible customer service!  Samsung should have contacted its clients reporting the bug - and should be contacting us regarding the status of resolution!  Really, really shameful!If it weren't such a pain I would return this and look for a better TV.

Reviews.Title: Love my TV
Reviews.Author: Deanna
Reviews.Content: Bought the 46" in March and love it! Sad to see it $300 less now than when I bought it, but I am still happy I purchased it. I do have to agree with other reviews that the smart hub is not that great for internet browsing, but I just hook my laptop up with an HDMI cable and am happy with that. I bought a logitech wireless mouse & keyboard for the TV and do use it from time to time, but like I said, smart hub doesn't work that great and closes unexpectedly so I tend to just use my computer. I LOVE the sound and picture quality of the tv and would recommend it to anyone looking for a nice Samsung 46" LED.

Reviews.Title: No problems with this TV
Reviews.Author: BigT
Reviews.Content: This TV was delivered on time and set up by the delivery guys. It looks great and I was amazed how light weight it was. Good picture, nice features.

Reviews.Title: Issues after 12 months of use
Reviews.Author: Hersetmi
Reviews.Content: TV has a good picture.  Smart TV is OK and has trouble with WiFi signal stability (my router is 30 feet away).  TV recently started turning on and off by itself.  I wouldn't recommend this product to my friends.

Reviews.Title: Poor browser
Reviews.Author: Leigh Truitt
Reviews.Content: I attempted to go to a site, zdf.de, and the site wouldn't load correctly using the browser on the TV.  I also attempted to play an embedded video movie on that site.  I could only hear the sound.  After talking with Samsung, I learned that the site uses Adobe Flash and that was the reason the site wouldn't load correctly or play an embedded video.  The browser included in the TV is apparently primitive.  I am planning on adding a direct computer feed to the TV at a cost of about $700 so that I can play embedded video on this site.  Samsung should have an adequate browser since they advertise this feature.Samsung UN60ES6100 60-Inch 1080p 240 Clear Motion Rate Slim LED HDTV (Black)

Reviews.Title: Great TV!!!
Reviews.Author: kristy156
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best TV's I have ever owned! If your going with a smart TV, you will need an internet router that is equally as great.http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B008I21EA2/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&camp;=1789&creative;=390957&creativeASIN;=B008I21EA2&linkCode;=as2&tag;=wwwworkoutwei-20

Reviews.Title: An Excellent choice for first time buyers
Reviews.Author: Bassius
Reviews.Content: If you are just now exploring LED TVs I'd highy recommend this one.  As this was my first led (switching over from plasma) I was buying on faith in samsung and the comments of others.  I was very pleased.  The screen is beautiful and i have had no problems with the tv itself.  Sometimes I can see the lighter pixels in the corners like others have mentioned but it really doesn't bug me much and i dont notice it when a movie or game is on, only when the screen is blank and no source is on.my only issue i have is with the smart hub network.  Sometimes samsung's servers just suck. (like today they are out) but I have a wii U and can stream with that when the smart hub is down.  I have a samsung blu ray player and they work so well together.  This is a great tv overall and worth the price.

Reviews.Title: TV's Great but Smart TV Sucks
Reviews.Author: Ravi Ramaswamy
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is superb, but the Smart TV part of it leaves a lot to be desired.  To stream Netflix, Hulu, etc.  a $99 Apple TV or Roku HD is infinitely better than using Smart TV.  The premium for Smart TV is just not worth the extra $200 - $300

Reviews.Title: Great tv at a low price
Reviews.Author: dluck2007
Reviews.Content: Great display than my sony lcd tv, thin panel, all black color, and the price is a bargain for a 60 inch led tv!I couldnt give it a 5 stars because the wifi is buggy and i cant connect to it.Other than that, i didnt regret my decision to buy this TV over the sony bravia ones.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME TV
Reviews.Author: cawood
Reviews.Content: great smart TV with Pandora and Netflix built in, super thin, and easy to use all of the great functions.  I would buy this again.

Reviews.Title: makes me happy
Reviews.Author: Joel
Reviews.Content: I think once I turned it on for the first time I cried a little bit. Yea it does not have the stupid 3D Bull@#$% but who wants to where glasses to watch tv anyway. There are some thing that should remain 2D. The smart hub is really nice and easy to navigate. I would suggest getting a wireless keyboard to make your life allot easier. Really with Amazon instant, netflix and Hulu pluss as long as you have internet you really dont need cable. If you are looking for a good TV that you don't have to take out a lone for this would be a good option.

Reviews.Title: great tv, just illogically placed power connector.
Reviews.Author: johndoe13
Reviews.Content: If you are wall mounting the tv, make sure your mount can clear the power cord housing, I don't know why Samsung did not move the plug, such a simple thing to overlook.Out of the box, the picture is definitely un-natural, so tweaking is required. Before that, I ran the software update; it seemed to go through, but I had to AC cycle the TV before the update took effect.I plan to use tv for Amazon Instant Video streaming, and that set up took time. All the other apps just worked as soon as network cable was attached, but the Amazon app failed to load, or quit without any message (I still haven't figured out why). Amazon customer service could only suggest attempting to re-install the firmware, but the TV wouldn't let me as it was already running the latest. The Amazon Instant Video app is baked in, and cannot be removed. Eventually, I set the DNS server to 8.8.8.8 (Google's public ones), and finally the Amazon app would run. Once I registered the TV, my watchlist was transferred, and I was streaming in HD; the quality is great.The best part of this TV however is the ability to stream from any device connected to the network. I don't know if the other series have this feature, or just the "smart" ones, but definitely worth the extra money. The TV automagically saw my Windows shares, and found the media; it seems to be able to handle Xvid and MPEG4 files (I did not have any success with h.264 encoded files).  The TV is limited to MP4 files less than 4GB (or maybe slightly smaller).The sound is better than I was expecting from such a thin TV, and is more than adequate for daily viewing. I like how the Youtube app lets you filter results for HD and SD files, my Sony blu-ray player cannot do this.

Reviews.Title: Basic functionality is awesome!
Reviews.Author: Matthew D Alspaugh
Reviews.Content: This is a great, thin, lightweight TV with a bright screen. The television performs wonderfully in bright, windowed rooms. Images are bold and beautiful. The screen is big enough to be used in a church worship space and meeting hall holding about 200 people. Even the built-in speakers are adequate in these situations in a pinch (we usually run the audio into our sound system).We have this television mounted on a cart (Peerless Universal Rolling Cart for 32 - 65 inches Flat Panel Screens Weighing Up to 150 lb (includes Metal Shelf, Black) and we roll it among several rooms, on an elevator, over bumps and thresholds. It has held up well to this use in the almost six months we've had it.I must admit the 'Smart TV' features are not all there, yet. They are very hard to access using the remote -- typing in searches, URLS, etc. is tedious. We've used these features only minimally. Even after upgrading our internet and wireless, the streaming video features are not reliable enough for group settings. I realize that this is not a flaw of the TV, but this is a reality for use in churches and similar group settings.We've have found that while playing material (video, music, slideshows) from a USB flash drive is very useful, the user interface for these leaves a little to be desired. FF and rewind in playing videos is non-intuitive. Setting up slideshows (of jpegs) is tedious, but workable. If you create your content on a Mac, be warned that the Mac leaves 'dot-files' (hidden files beginning with a dot, one for every content file you create) on your drive, and the TV whines about playing these. It ought to silently ignore these files. There are ways to remove these hidden files, it just adds another step in the creation process. When you play music (mp3) from your drive, the TV shows a large graphic of a CD spinning -- I guess that's better than a cassette tape graphic, but not by much.That last comment brings up one minor annoyance in using this TV in a church setting. It's really hard to get it to go to a black screen. There's always something on the screen, an error message, or some built-in graphic on the screen.With all the limitations of the Smart TV interface, we tend to plug in a notebook PC (note: you'll need an adapter like ViewHD Mini VGA to HDMI Converter) if you are using older PC with just VGA output) and run Powerpoint shows. This gives better control for only modest additional effort.Oh, and Samsung does offer a free iPhone app for controlling the TV via wifi. This is helpful when you want to control the TV from the sides or back of the room.

Reviews.Title: Best LED TV Yet!
Reviews.Author: Barrett
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV on Black Friday expecting just an LED HDTV. What I got was more than I bargained for! This is a 3D LED TV that came with 2-free 3D Glasses that sync to the TV when you turn the glasses on. The WiFi works excellent and the picture quality is truly amazing. I have a 55" LG LED TV, but this Samsung beats the picture quality of the LG. This is a great TV for the price. I would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: MIKE
Reviews.Content: This TV has worked perfectly from the moment I took it out of the box.  Great product, I would reccomend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: I am pleased with the quality of the picture.  I wasn't sure if I should have purchased an LCD or the LED.
Reviews.Author: Carl Pardon
Reviews.Content: It is the right size for my room.  The picture is great.  Wish I could see the channels in the full screen picture mode, but I use the remote that came with my AT&T; box and then I get the channels.

Reviews.Title: Best TV I have seen!
Reviews.Author: OSUB3av3r
Reviews.Content: This 60" Samsung UN60ES6100 TV has the best picture that I have seen.  The smart hub is OK.  The best app available is Plex for streaming your own movies.  The built in wireless works very well for streaming movies.  The sound is average.  I would recommend a sound bar or using a home theater system.  The delivery was late but Amazon was awesome on making it right.  Overall I'm very happy with this TV especially with the price that I got it for.

Reviews.Title: I bought this TV because it has a GREAT picture!
Reviews.Author: R. Grissom "Thriller Man"
Reviews.Content: UPDATE:  Two months now and I love this TV.  Just buy it!We got our new 60" 6100 TV installed three days ago.  My first goal was to purchase a TV with a great picture that could tolerate a room with some light in it.  I did a HUGE amount of research, considered all brands and eliminated things down to either a Samsung LED or a Panasonic Plasma.  All of the reviews from Cnet and elsewhere seem to agree.  Of course you can always pay more, but I purchased this on from Amazon Black Friday during a short time when the price dropped to $1397, free shipping plus another $157 for four additional years of warranty from Square Deal.  I'm sure some paid more, likely some paid less, but I'm happy to share that I feel that is an outstanding value.  Again, do your own research but perhaps this will help you find peace is this is how you are leaning.Prior to purchasing, I read so many reviews that my wife felt I was likely to go crazy with information overload.  Thankfully, I survived and purchased with confidence.  I began the Samsung LED quest by looking at the 8000.  It's loaded with features and I chose to pass on some of those features to stay more simple and yet have the ability to use the built-in Wi-Fi, etc.  I have NOT gotten deep into using them at this time, but I will and I will add to this review 'if' something is noteworthy.  My expectations are not too high, thus it's likely that I'll get what I expected.The picture out of the box was indeed a bit too high in contrast for our eyes.  I changed too many items in the beginning and then hit 'reset' and started over slowly.  It was a piece of cake to make it superb.  You can change it constantly if you like to do that, but you can also get it 'right' and be happy.  I'm the latter.UPDATE on tuning the picture.  I am still looking for "just right" for all occasions.  I think I can get to that point but it can be frustrating if you let it get to you.UPDATE I have decided that, for ME, the matte finish was the thing that I had to adapt to more than anything.  That took about a week, plus more tweaking of the tuning of colors, etc., and now I think this is a GREAT looking, performing TV as I said from the start.  I don't see why 'some' say that the Smart part is not any good.  I have nothing to compare it to but I think it's superb.The Motion feature is quite interesting.  Some say a bit like a soap opera.  At this time, my wife and I like it but it can be disabled easily enough.I have no idea about how the Sound is since I have it hooked to a very high-end Bose system.  I'm sure there are other reviews that can help you with that one.Let me stop this now........I will return 'if' it is worthwhile to tell more.  Good luck and hope you enjoy it as much as I am thus far.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: Could not ask for a better TV for the money paid. All that I needed and more. Love the apps, the sharpness of the image, easy of use menus. Connecting to my WiFi was easy and trouble free. Watching movies from the USB stick is great (I use .mov and .m4v formats). Don't particularly care about the "Auto Motion Plus" picture feature. Makes the movies and shows look as if you are watching some "live" show. Hard to explain, but the picture just does not look right to me. Some people may like this "alternate" view mode; I didn't. Turned the feature OFF. Along with all the Dynamic Contrast, and all the "energy saving" picture settings (that adjust brightness, etc. automatically for you based on the environment); turned those OFF too. Other than the tweaks mentioned here, the image is nice. Good overall TV and I recommend it. Will see how long it lasts...I cannot comment on the quality/reliability of this product yet since I just got it.

Reviews.Title: Wow!!!
Reviews.Author: G.Ziegler
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review as a thank you  to the people who wrote one before me!  Also to help those who are trying to make a  buying decision. Your comments encouraged me to consider the Samsung.  I am blown away at this work of technological genius.  For the first 2 1/2 hours I was giddy just watching it.  This is very out of character for me.  For goodness sakes I am almost 60 years old.  I have never been a material person.  It takes a lot for me to part with my hard earned money.  Would have never guessed so few dollars could give so much enjoyment.  Granted the Samsung is replacing a 1985 Toshiba 32 inch TV.  But my goodness the colors and the clarity from this set are amazing and this is with an antenna!  The colors seem better than real life.  Is that possible?  There were challenges trying to get the set to work.  I attached the antenna and the VCR (Yes, a VCR).  I tried a number of cabling arrangements to no avail.  Finally I called Samsung help line.  They said I did everything they knew of and they would have to have the next line of tech help call me in the next 24 - 48 hours.  Really, I just bought a new TV and I wanted to watch it!  When I tried to nail down a time, I was rebuffed.  I understand they might not be able to help me right away, but 24 - 48 hours?  Then the support person asked if from 2 - 5PM was OK.  It was 6:30 PM!  I asked her to have them call me ASAP.  She seemed not to know what that meant.  She also called me Johnny all the time.  She took my information and she should have known my name was Greg.  After I hung up, I continued to try to figure out what was going on.  Finally I hit the channel list button and hit enter.  I had picture!  It was all worth it.  The picture is super and the sound is good.  I haven't tried the web yet BECAUSE I have been enjoying the picture.  The only down side of this whole experience is the giddiness is subsiding.  :)

Reviews.Title: Samsung smart TV
Reviews.Author: Sonya
Reviews.Content: I love it! This is a great tv -- lightweight, nice picture, tons of features, has surprisingly nice sound, and is exactly what I was looking for, delivery was free and fast.

Reviews.Title: Great picture!  Don't like toslink digital sound output
Reviews.Author: T. Yager
Reviews.Content: Great TV!  Picture was off as received, but I used the settings given in some of these reviews and now the picture is WONDERFUL!  I was a bit disappointed with the digital toslink output.  For all HDMI inputs, the digital output is only 2.0.  The TV only outputs 5.1 when it receives the program by itself.  This is great if you use a sound system with only 2.0, but lousy if you have a 5.1 or better sound system.  Since all my inputs are via HDMI (except internet reception) I can't use the capability of my sound system without external digital switching, which is expensive, cumbersome, and unreliable.  I didn't realize this limitation until I read the fine print in the manual.The internet capability of the TV seems good.  I don't use it much (yet), but I get good reception.  I guess it is not a computer and I didn't expect it to be.  The speakers are okay.  I have another Samsung which is mounted on a stand on a table and sounds better.  Since this new TV is wall mounted, maybe the acoustics of my room don't work as well.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 46" 6100 Series SmartTV
Reviews.Author: BruceG
Reviews.Content: This is generally an excellent television. It is slim, elegant, has an excellent picture, and a variety of control functions that generally make it easy to set up the television. Samsung's on-line support has not yet been tested as of this writing but navigating the menus is pretty intuitive. The remote has large keys clearly identified and it was very easy to mate the television to the HDTV cable box. We have not yet cabled the TV to the A/V receiver so we don't know how easy that will be (with HDMI it is theoretically easy but we'll have to see). We have not yet tried to stream anything so I have no comment on the use of the SmartHub system.The quality of the HD image is remarkable - clear, bright, with accurate color and excellent resolution. Sporting events and programs specifically shot in HD are absolutely gorgeous. Our one complaint has been picture quality with programs or movies NOT shot in HD. Visually, the image is flattened and jumps around a bit. These effects make some programs look like they were shot with late 1970's hand-held video camera technology - they look like a soap opera. This is especially disconcerting in B&W; movies shot on film so I am trying to figure out the settings that will minimize this.

Reviews.Title: Awesome HDTV!!!
Reviews.Author: 70's lover
Reviews.Content: This is my first Samsung HDTV, and overall I'm very pleased with it.  I mainly purchased it for the visual quality this particular brand provides for viewing movies, specials and concerts: dvd's and especially blu ray.  I'm still not completely sold on the 3D HDTV's out on the market including those offered by this company.  It would be wise for Samsung to include more picture mode aspect setting selections for movies that are filmed extra wide than what this model provides.  This is my only gripe.  The 240 clear motion feature is totally superior to others HDTV's even regular dvd's have a better visual quality that I don't find elsewhere, and this model isn't even the top of the line! I was completely pleased by the service and delivery of my new TV by this vendor and I give both the TV and vendor 5 stars all the way!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Wireless Maybe?
Reviews.Author: Ralph Russell "student of history"
Reviews.Content: We bought this TV only because it is sold as wireless for Netflix and such sites. When we got it set up, I spent 2 hours with Verizon trying to get it to connect to my Lan. Then the next morning 2 hours more, changed the wep key to Wpa which was a suggestion of Samsung chat person, still no hookup. It sees the network but will not connect. Then I called Samsung Service and the guy tells me I must be within 30' of router(I am), and the router be in the same room as the TV. I could say that it is. When he was done he suggested I tape an ethernet cable to the walls and ceiling since we have a slab foundation and the floors are laminate. Having vaulted ceilings against the roof rafters makes running a wire thru the walls or floor impossible. He said a wired internet hook up would work. I bought the TV to be wireless.I also had an LAN extender shipped overnight and that did not help at all. Still no hookup but the network is always shown on the TV screen during the setup process.On Page 10 of the manual I see a note tonite after messing with this thing for 3 days the TV does not support a network with speeds equal to or less than 10 Mbps!!! Duh!!! DSL is about 3 MBps. Works fine with my Sony BlueRay DVD player.Why did no one at Samsung tell me this fact? They obviosly do not know there product. I am no tech genius by any means but I do know my way around computers, etc. I think this overall experience is typical of retailing today. Sell the product-forget the details and limitations.Unfortunately I must return this otherwise fine TV and start over again. I am not going to change ISP's to satisfy their needs and I am furious at the run around I received from Samsung instead of FACTS.Caveat Emptor !

Reviews.Title: DUMB Hub - Do Not BUY
Reviews.Author: hiddenattempt
Reviews.Content: Overall the picture quality is very nice - but Samsung insists that you have all these crappy apps - and their server (SmartHub) are consistently down - which seems to be an ongoing problems since 2011 (if you go back and do some research). I would buy a SONY or Panasonic - SONY has already upgraded their system to handle major network traffic.

Reviews.Title: Smart Hub does not support flash
Reviews.Author: Ars
Reviews.Content: As far as picture quality I have no complaints.  But for those of you buying this tv for it's "smart tv" feature, it's junk.  The layout and search feature of all the apps are crap.  Samsung browser does not support flash therefore the youtube app does not work at all.update switched DNS to 8.8.8.8 (google's server) youtube works fine now.

Reviews.Title: Picture Adjustments impossible to get right
Reviews.Author: E. Hayes "goatherdered"
Reviews.Content: I tried for hours to get my picture to look as good as my old tv and couldnt.  The back light kept dimming when there was a dark scene on the screen.  I found movie mode solved that, but then all the colors looked washed out.  I got sick of messing with it and returned it to Best Buy.Cons:- picture adjustments impossible to get right- blueish color to the picture never went away- Samsung can only "remotely administer" the TV between 9-6 Eastern time.- Glossy screenPro- 40 lb 55" TV

Reviews.Title: Overated  HDTV
Reviews.Author: Scott E. Fisher
Reviews.Content: We bought this unit at a warehouse store (C*stc*) after reading reviews and looking at the units on display. From the moment I got it home and hooked up, I had doubts. Firstly, all of the preset modes except movie looked cartoonish. Both of us thought our dying Sony KDL46W4100 looked vastly better when it was working. I used some calibration settings I found on the web, and they did improve the picture to a point, but the whites washed out frequently, and after two weeks of fiddling and messing around, I bought an LG 47LS4600 47-Inch 1080p 120Hz LED LCD HDTV that was $250 less at the other warehouse store (S*ms). The key for me was skin tones. The LG just does them better than this Samsung. The LG has no wireless, but I was able to update it with a usb stick, just like my old Sony. As to the smart features, 95% of what is offered is not needed. I can do everything I need with apps on our PS3. It's $35 of electronics, that add duplicity, and $250 to the retail cost. Needless to say, this Samsung got returned.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Downgrade
Reviews.Author: Kozie
Reviews.Content: I received this unit as a replacent for the UND6000 of which a black line appeared horizontally across the screen within 24 days of purchase.  The exchange dept answered my detailed questions about the specs since it had just came out that day. He sounded like he knew what he was talking about. When I received the TV, some things were left out and deceit started to show. There is only one component/composite connection. All input ports except 2 USB and 1 HDMI  are on the back just in over 1/4th of the TVs size. I'm unable to access those ports due to my "universal" wall mount. This worked with 3 other Samsung TVs as well as all other brands. 2012's change has made it so you either have to purchase a Samsung mount or the spidered out mount. My mount is pretty expensive and can hold a tv from 32"-70". This is very frustrating.Secondly, there is annoying beep on the TV when you push the volume buttons or when navigating with directional pad.  Can't find an "off" option anywhere.I would wait until later in the year to purchase the 2012 TVs. It seems as if their agenda is to quickly make and get it out now. Let them fix the issues first. Why would you downgrade from 1 component and 2 composite connections anyways? Doesn't make sense to me at all.Besides those, pretty good picture, sound and web connectivity.

Reviews.Title: Good for about 3 weeks
Reviews.Author: NoExpert
Reviews.Content: We bought this TV a few weeks ago and were impressed with the picture and features.  After watching it tonight for about an hour, the screen went blank.  We had sound, but no picture...even the TV's menu didn't work.  As I looked around the back of the unit with a flashlight to check the connections, I shined the light on the front panel and could see the faint ghost of the picture.  It appears that the backlight for this TV crapped out.I never had bad luck with Samsung before.  Hopefully we just got a bad unit.

Reviews.Title: The TV I bought from bigoutlet can not be turnd on totally
Reviews.Author: TDK1
Reviews.Content: This TV I just bought from bigoutlet can not be turned on totally, it is a broken TV the seller sold. Moreover, it's a sooooo long time the seller deliverd this TV to me, it's almost a month since I ordered this TV and I'm still waiting for  fixative feedback from Samsung customer service!!!

Reviews.Title: Never again, Samsung!
Reviews.Author: A Customer
Reviews.Content: About six months ago, subsequent to one of the updates Samsung rolled out, Netflix started acting up:  it takes anywhere from 2-20 (yes, 20!) attempts to actually play an item before it is successful.  This is extremely annoying, to say the least:  you can sit there pressing "OK" over and over and over for a good 7 minutes before you can start viewing.Try watching a series of 30-minute shows this way.Then, some updates later, the problem got even worse:  now, I have to sign into Netflix EVERY TIME.  It does NOT remember my email or password.  I have to enter is all.  Again.  Every time.  And then I'm still left with the "20 attempts before anything plays" problem.Now, before the nerds jump in here to blame me:  I'm a nerd myself.  My network is well-configured.  I've tried both wired and wireless.  EVERY OTHER DEVICE works!  I've got a Roku, two tablets, various desktops and laptops, all running wirelessly, that have NO PROBLEMS with Netflix.Also, Amazon Video experiences the exact same behavior!  So this is obviously NOT my Network, or Netflix:  it's a Samsung problem.  Now I have a $1200 item that does precisely one of the many things it was supposed to do:  it shows pictures.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: My tv broke 5 weeks after purchase. It took 21 days for the Samsung guy to finally bring the correct parts. The repair man said that Samsung uses refurbished parts for warranty work. So now my tv that I paid the brand new price for has all used parts in it. Do not buy Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Author: great services
Reviews.Content: My 46" samsung LED TV just arrived few days ago.. I finally got a chance to open it and hook it up and I love it.. I don't know what I've been waiting for all this time to purchase this TV..  I love Love Love Love it!!!

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV!
Reviews.Author: Jesler G. Garcia Rojas "jesler"
Reviews.Content: After a lot of research, I finally decided on the 46" LED Samsung Smart TV. The size is perfect for my living room, It's super slim and ultra sleek.. The Samsung LED TV's have great picture quality, and in stores they always stood out next to the other brands. This was a fair price for the quality product you get in the end. My whole family has thoroughly enjoyed this TV's clarity for sports and Blu-Ray movies. I wanted a Samsung LED because of the remarkable clarity I'd seen on store models and this TV is no exception. if you want a TV with an amazingly clear, rich, colorful picture , you won't go wrong with this one.Pros:-Easy To Set Up-All the connections options you could ever need-Energy Efficient-Great Picture Quality-Great Sound Quality- Works great with Netflix!Cons-None

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV, very pleased with this model
Reviews.Author: M. Katona "mkjava"
Reviews.Content: Our older LCD projection TV died a couple of weeks ago which suddenly put me in the market for a new one.  I wanted to focus on thin LED models with Smart TV functions, and the 46"-47" size was perfect for my family room.  I had no interest in the 3D feature so I didn't consider paying extra for that in a TV.  After looking at different models in the store (Samsung, Sharp, Vizio, Sony, LG, and Panasonic), I narrowed it down to this Samsung vs. the Sony KDLEX645.  The features and picture quality were extremely similar between the 2 models, so I ended up going with the one that had the better price at the time, which was this Samsung.I can't speak for the Sony, but we've had this Samsung for over a week now and are very happy with it. We were never unhappy with our old TV, but we honestly didn't know what we were missing until we saw the picture on this one.  In most shows, it really seems like you're looking through a window vs. a TV screen, it's that lifelike.  I'm also happy with the Smart TV functions, we've used it mainly for Netflix so far and that works well.  I've seen a few complaints in the reviews here on the Smart functions on this TV, but I haven't seen a problem yet.  The menus are intuitive to use and fairly responsive.  I wouldn't replace my Macbook or iPad for this as my web browser of course, but this does what I want it to do.  All in all very pleased with this purchase and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Nice tv
Reviews.Author: woodworks
Reviews.Content: I have only had the television a month and I don't watch it daily ,but so far so good.As other reviewers have mentioned the hub is weak,but I have enjoyed the tv so far.I haven't got my settings the way I want them,so once I get them set I can offer a more detailed review. I followed the settings some other reviewers gave,but they did not work for me.So I will continue to tweak until I have a better picture.If anyone has this particular set I'm willing to listen.

Reviews.Title: Great in HD, poor when viewing regular tv.
Reviews.Author: Wasta12 "Jim"
Reviews.Content: This tv is great when viewing HD content.  It is easy to set up and the "Smart Hub" function is well thought out and easy to navigate.  Having a full keyboard would have been a plus.The one major down side is that viewing non HD channels is poor. The picture is blurred. I tried to change the setting but that has not helped. There is no compaison to my 46 inch Sharp Quattron. The picture on this tv is awesome.Bottom line, if using this tv for HD viewing then it's not a bad choice, if you want to watch a mix of HD and regular definition, keep looking.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy
Reviews.Author: Jasen Dahn "2yellowdogs"
Reviews.Content: Really happy with the TV,  Picture is great and the sound is far better than I expected.  The Smart TV feature works fine for us with Netflix and Amazon streaming,  have not used it for anything besides that.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Hobbes007
Reviews.Content: No complaints on this purchase!  It has a great picture quality to it and love the apps!  Time to get a Samsung Smart Phone to use with it!

Reviews.Title: Great Tv
Reviews.Author: BESIAN DEMA
Reviews.Content: I like the fact that is a tv/computer. apps are amazing and the video quality is great. I hate the control and the sound it does every time you press it.

Reviews.Title: Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Chuck S
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful wide screen HDTV for an apartment or smaller family room.  Big enough to be "big screen" but not overwhelming.  Smart TV gets "apps," YouTube, Netflix, and several others.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Sungsu Lee "nightimp"
Reviews.Content: Nice size for 6-8 feet distance.easy function for smart TV.If you use wireless keyboard, It will be more easier.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Ricardo Diaz
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for almost a year and it has been working great.  The picture quality is very good and the channel changing speed is not slow.  It looks great and it is very slim.  It does not have 3D, but since I am not into 3D it is not a problem for me.  I can't find one bad thing to say about this tv.

Reviews.Title: Decent TV
Reviews.Author: Zheng C. Lin
Reviews.Content: It turns out it is a decent TV for my bedroom. It actually is a smart TV but feel that user interface is a little bit slow ut overall it is a good product.

Reviews.Title: Great tv for the money
Reviews.Author: Hayz4040
Reviews.Content: I've had this set now for about month now and I love it I get compliments on it all the timeI've only had this for a short time but so far I've not had any issues picture quality is great best I've had so far!

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Graham
Reviews.Content: We are very pleased with this model from Samsung, the picture is even sharper than last year's model and I specifically bought this model because it is equipped with 3 HDMI ports not just 2 and built in wifi.

Reviews.Title: An Amazing TV  55 inches of amazing clear color viewing.  BUY IT
Reviews.Author: Bruce Cheadle
Reviews.Content: this is the best TV I have ever owned.  The clearity of the picture is almost TOO real.  It is increadible.  I looked at a lot of TVs and there is nothing to compare.  Just got it so am still learning all the "SMART" TV functions like getting on internet, using SKYPE, etc.  Highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Awesome picture quality with DISMAL SmartTV function
Reviews.Author: J. Yoon
Reviews.Content: Sorry - can't give you a highly technical review. Suffice it to say the picture quality is INCREDIBLE. Even those old 60s batman shows with Adam West look "hi-def". I struggled for a couple of weeks with the Smart TV function. After reviewing other Amazon reviews, I figured it was not my internet service or wireless connection but rather the Smart TV function was not quite up to par. I purchased a BluRay with WiFi, plugged it in with an HDMI cable and I was streaming video within 1/2 an hour via Amazon Prime. Incredible! Highly recommended for picture quality. Smart function is not so smart.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I wanted
Reviews.Author: Matthew Olney

Reviews.Title: This TV is a great value for money
Reviews.Author: John T Ringham
Reviews.Content: I went into this purchase with a little trepidation having read some of the other reviews that warned of the performance of this display.  Honestly though, I couldn't be happier.  We got a fair price around black Friday - $800, though i'd still pay the $900 I've seen it on sale for in brick-and-mortar shops.  After calibrating and shutting off whatever Samsung calls their tru-motion anti-blur option, the picture is great.  Sound is a little weak, but I think that's to be expected in a TV that's just over an inch thick.  Just get a soundbar, I guess.We own a Roku, so I didn't need a smart TV, really; I'm glad we went with the ES model though instead of the EH though - less components and wires seem like a good idea.  The smart TV Hub is pretty slow though.  That's one area I'll agree with the other reviewers on.  I haven't tried any of the higher range 2012 Samsung sets in store, but I'm guessing they have faster processors or more memory to be a little snappier.Oh, and download a remote app on your phone - it's really frustrating trying to navigate the clunky browser or search in apps with the stock Samsung remote, even worse than typing with the old Roku remote.  Otherwise, enjoy your set!

Reviews.Content: Decided to upgrade my 3 year old 52 inch Samsung LCD 120htz to the bigger 60 inch LED.  I was expecting a better picture, it is noticeably worse. The Smart feature is cool, but slow, and difficult to use without keyboard-- not worth the cost, though.  If it weren't for the trouble and cost of taking off the wall and reshipping, this thing would be going back.  Now I'm stuck with a TV that I don't even enjoy watching.  Should have gone with 55-inch with better specs...

Reviews.Title: This TV is awesome
Reviews.Author: Stephen Yu "Willow"
Reviews.Content: I purchased 4 Samsung LCD TV's already (all through Amazon), but this one is the first LED TV for us. In short, this 60" TV looks great regardless of the source.  The physical size of the TV is almost same as my existing 52 inch LCD TV, and from the side, this one looks considerably thinner.I tried to set the picture mode just like my old TV, and found out that this LED TV is much brighter and tonal quality is very different.  I could achieve the same type of skin color that I am accustomed to, but I ended up using different combination of settings.  For other TV's, I started with "Movie" mode and tweaked finer settings.  For this one, I resorted back to "Standard" mode, as the "Movie" setting returned really pale skin tones.  Then I set the tone to "Warm 1" as default setting on standard was to blue-skewed.  I also brought down the background like from 11 to 9, and brightness to 42.  Otherwise, the dark portion becomes grey-ish.In any case, while this TV is incredible bright, the dark portions of the pictures are almost pitch black. Plus, there are a few options to tweak the dark colors.  I'd freeze the frame at a dark scene with heavy contrast, and tweak all the dark options.The motion control is a little more advanced, and now we can customize it for sporting events with lots of fast moving objects, as well as film based sources with different shutter speed. If you don't like what they call "soap opera effect", you can customize your options without sacrificing the settings you have for ball games.  I ended up setting it to "custom" mode 10 and 7 for Blu-ray and 10 and 8 for satellite, for example.  I played with scenes where the camera is panning, and pick the number with least jitters and acceptable "soap opera effect" (to which I am somewhat accustomed already).Smart TV part is OK, but I found myself resorting back to Apple TV when it comes to Internet based sources.  The web browser on this TV is a joke and I wouldn't spend time on it.  There is no way one can type in even "1" web address with this remote control.  Plus, the response time is very slow. Thank goodness for the 3rd HDMI input where my Apple TV is connected.The sound on this TV is just horrible.  I customized it to enhance mid range and the bass, but the speakers are just plain inadequate.  It's bare adequate for news broadcasting. So I tried to connect powered Bose speakers for everyday watching, but there was no head phone jack where I can control volumes though TV.  There is an output jack size of regular head phone on the back, but the volume is fixed at one level, and the TV remote does not control the volume.  Through provide optical audio output, I connected the TV to my main amplifier.  For movies and concerts, that is the only option.  But I know that the rest of my family wouldn't even think about turning on the amp just to watch TV.  That is why I always had a decent set powered speakers connected to flat panel TV's, but with this one, we just don't have that option.All in all, this is an amazing TV.  With good picture sources like HD satellite box, Apple TV, and especially Blu-ray, the pictures are just amazing, and at times I regret that I didn't go for a larger screen.  With non-HD pictures, well, you can see every flaw and it can be somewhat bothersome. Until every picture source becomes HD quality, and 3-D sources become more abundant, this 2-D TV would do.  And that will be a long time (well, at least 2-3 years).

Reviews.Author: Aaauger
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of good reviews here but it doesn't matter when your TV is the one that fails. We have a previous model of the Samsung 55 in. LED TV, purchased at the end of 2011. We got a sizable gray spot on the screen at the end of 2012 - less than a week before the end of the warranty.Samsung sent out a repair team. It tried replacing the screen - which by the way costs $1,200. When the replacement screen failed, they said that Samsung would authorize an exchange. When we tried to do the exchange, the original retailer said we would have to pay an additional $500 to replace the failed TV with an equivalent model. Why would anyone do that, Samsung?Fortunately, the retailer located the same model in a warehouse. Otherwise, our understanding is that a store credit would have been issued - as opposed to a refund. We can't be sure because our Samsung contacts told so many different stories. Maybe Samsung should go into the publishing business instead.Meanwhile, Samsung's business model seems to deal with product failure by driving customers to other manufacturers.

Reviews.Title: Very nice
Reviews.Author: Theodore J. Jackson Sr.
Reviews.Content: I have now owned 4 high def televisions in 8 years. My first a 37" Sony CRT model. Very big, heavy (150 lbs) with a perfect picture.Next was a 37" Samsung with a nice look and picture.Couple of years later upgraded to a Samsung 40" Smart tv Again, a nice look and picture and Yahoo widgets The Netflix library was also very nice and has a preferable interface to the one on this new set in my opinion.I recently decided to upgrade to a bigger screen with the new slimmer bezel. Bought a Sony 46" and never got a high def picture on it. Was on the phone with Sony for the better part of an hour. Returned for a refund.Then tried a Vizio 46". Had a beautiful frame on it but it kept messing with my DVR high def resolution (again spent a lot of time on phone with Vizio support.) While I was toying with it I also noticed it had a flaw in the screen on the left upper corner. Returned for a refund.Came back to Samsung with this set and it set up easily and perfectly. The picture is excellent, even better than my previous two Samsungs. With the nice slim bezel. My opinion and experience is nobody does overall quality better than Samsung.Some people it seems prefer the 4 pronged leg stand over the solid glass. I do not. The stand looks like cheaply painted black metal to me. Much prefer the glass swivel.Also I became addicted to the ease of use of Yahoo widgets (popped up at the bottom of the screen) for checking the weather while continuing to watch tv.  I checked the weather and temperature all the time with my old set. Also Pandora and Amazon instant video were more easily accessed using widgets.Having said all that, this new set was on sale @ $799 and it is a very good tv and a lot of it @ that price.

Reviews.Content: I originally gave this tv 5 stars right after I bought it, but now I'm changing my review.This tv is the biggest piece of junk. It was a waste of $1800. I should have bought an LG. If your considering buying this tv, please don't. Just buy LG.Here are my reasons:-I used to own a Samsung 60" LCD 1080p that I purchased in 2010. I loved the tv, but it was damaged by an ex girlfriend. So I figured anther Samsung would be a good idea. I figured the picture on this tv would be even better since it was LED. Boy was I wrong. The colors suck and the picture is not very clear. I knew it as soon as I turned it on and saw a hd channel. Now, I regret returning it.-Netflix never works properly. Almost everytime I turn on Netflix, the tv makes me login now. Everytime I select something to watch, I get a message that says "We're having trouble playing this title right now. Please try again later or select a different title". I have to keep selecting it about 10 times in a row before I can get the title to play. The tv never did any of this when I first got it.-The speaker is horrible. My old Samsung LCD had better sound. The sound volume is to low. If you want it loud, you have to turn it up almost all the way. Then the speakers start to vibrate when its up loud. I even turned down the lowest frequency on the equalizer and it didn't help.-The biggest thing that makes me mad about this tv is the ghosting and clouding. Whenever the tv goes to a solid black screen, you can see white lines coming out of the corners and white clouds in different spots on the screen. When a dark/night scene in a movie or show comes on, you can see the white lines coming from the corners and the clouds.To sum things up, I would highly recommend that no one buys this tv. Go with a LG. I know someone who just bought a 55" LG LED smart tv and it looks great.

It sticks way too far out the back to mount the TV flush on the wall without putting a big hole right behind it.  Third, and it may not be bad for some, there is only one hdmi that mounts in the recess at a 90* angle on the back.  all the others come right out the back and not even in the recess.  All of this combined makes it difficult to mount an advertised 1.2" thin TV on the wall like i had expected.

Reviews.Title: Great Features but Terrible Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: Chill
Reviews.Content: The picture quality on this TV is not great.  I have broken this review into two sections.Subjective:Deep black helps with picture quality (lower cd/m2 for black=higher contrast ratio=better picture quality).  Color accuracy is also important with obtaining great picture quality.  In my opinion, the black level was not deep enough. Therefore, the picture did not pop for me.  The blacks looked gray, and the colors faded once I was off to the side (viewing angle).  I was watching a football game two weekend ago and notice that the grass/turf on the field was unnatural due to green being undersaturated.  When I was watching a blu-ray movie with an all-black screen, the backlight would shut off and was slow to come back on again.  Please read CNET review on this issue under the black level section on the Samsung 65ES6500.  When this TV was in my possession, I noticed some light showing on the edge of the TV screen (screen uniformity).  This is a common problem with most edge-lit LED LCD TVs. Motion was fine with sports and movies for the most part.  However, I saw some issues with motion when I watched ESPN/ESPNEWS. There is a lot of movement on this channel for any TV, but I do not think that it was a big deal since it handled most of the content that I watch on a normal basis. I also thought that the sound quality was better on the Samsung 55ES6100 than my Panasonic TC-P50ST50. I really like the apps/web browser on this TV.  However, picture quality is my number one priority when it comes to a TV.Measurements from Calibration:The color management system did not work.  Once I changed the color space from Auto to Custom to adjust the six colors, green was really undersaturated.  The Custom color space  showed dE (cie 94) greater than 3 with green, blue, and yellow.  The Auto color space showed dE (cie 94) greater than 3 with green and yellow. The Auto color space showed less than 1.5 dE (cie 94) with red, cyan, and magenta which is great. Blue was average with a dE (cie 94) of 2.3.  The viewing angle (10-15 degrees from center of the TV (viewing angle)) and screen uniformity were terrible(some light on the left/right edges of the screen).  The TV calibrated easily to D65(6500K) due to the 10-point white balance adjustments. The grayscale was incredible with a dE (cie 94) of 0.6. The average gamma measured 2.17 which is excellent.  The target for gamma is 2.22.  Contrast/backlight was set approximately to achieve 40 ftL.  The black level measured 0.095 cd/m2 (all-black screen).  The black level was set so that 0-15 IRE was clipped.  I was looking for 0.05 cd/m2 based on televisioninfo.com review for this TV.  Please beware of the information on this website.These were my observations with this TV, and your mileage may vary due to unit-to-unit variation.

Reviews.Title: Pic quality OK, but thats about it

Reviews.Content: Hard to decide how many stars to give this as the # 1 thing for any TV is Pic Quality & the pic quality on this is just fine (I think the pic quality on my LG is better tho). Fine, not awesome & considering the pic quality is all this TV has going for it, I cant justify giving more then 2 stars as you can get a much cheaper samsung with identical pic quality & without all the shortcomings of this model.Not going to go in to too much detail other then to say samsungs make great tv's but seemed to take a step back with many of their 2012 models.Again, pic quality was fine..not awesome but certainly very good.EVERYTHING else was just horrible & too much to list so I'll just say if you like the pic quality & are set on a samsung, go with a lower model for ALOT cheaper & get the same pic quality as this, without all the shortcomings...its almost like Samsung is charging more $'s for headaches & issues & a 'burdensome tv' you'll end up wanting to throw the AWFUL remote right thru the screen.......Pic quality was fine but everything else was horrible so back to the retailer it went....I swapped it for an lg lm 7600 whose pic quality is better in my opinion & EVERYTHING ELSE IS GREAT & BLOWS THIS SAMMY OUT OF THE WATER. My retailer even said that 'samsungs are their most popular selling brand' but they also said the 2012 models 'took a step backwards' & they had ALOT of people quite unhappy with this and a few other 2012 samsung models & many were bringing them back to exhange with 95% going with the LM series from LG & they also said the feedback was great & most all folks who exchanged the sammy for the LG were THRILLED THEY DID (Put me on the top of that list!). They did say Sony was awesome, which I already knew from having one, but they were very pricey so most opted for the LG when exchanging & yes, I was a bit surprised they said the other 5% or so went with a Panasonic, which i've heard both great and bad things about depending on the model....The Panasonic's I looked at were nice, but the LG was the clear winner for quality & price.Anyway, glad I exchanged as I LOVE my LG LM 7600 but again, if your dead set on a samsung, no prob.... the pic quality was good so just avoid this model & go with a much cheaper model that will give you the same pic quality for alot less money & alot less headaches...
