Reviews.Title: This is NOT a review...yet...Now it is.
Reviews.Author: Marvin Cohn "drdos43"
Reviews.Content: This one gets 5 stars all the way with no exceptions.IF YOU JUST WANT TO WATCH TV PROGRAMS, DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS TV.To review this TV for all it can do is impossible. We were one of the first to receive it and I, being somewhat conversant with computers, am simply amazed.The picture quality is superb and the sound is more than adequate for most applications, something for which flat screens are downgraded...not this one....and there is no LED bleeding what-so-ever.First, the TV recognized my wi-fi (Belkin) setup immediately.I attached my Iogear keyboard (@$35 on Amazon...which has a tracking ball, mouse, and scroll functions) to the TV. The TV notified me that some functions of the keyboard will not work. I changed the home page to Google on the Web option and initiated the pointer option. However, just about everything does work, only sometimes a little differently than on a computer. What doesn't work directly from the keyboard, does work from the TV remote...like calling up a querty keyboard so the querty keyboard on the Iogear works (a single click on the mouse on any input field). An enhanced remote will be available for no charge in 10-12 weeks.We now have a TV with the best picture I have ever seen and another full-fledged computer as well.We have access to just about everything on the Net, including our banking and bill pay accounts. However, there are somethings which will not work directly because you need a specific program not yet supported by Samsung; but you can even get around this by going to sites that have their own video players, etc....Hulu (Hulu Plus is a Samsung App.),Spreety,TVPC,World Wide Internet (@3000 channels), etc. etc. etc. That does not include the hundreds of applications with which Samsung provides you, most of them at no charge.It seems that there is nothing that this computer cannot do (Skype is included)except perhaps attaching a printer...and that may come with the HDMI ARC port, that a computer cannot do.Every day, I discover something new.----------------------------------------------------------------------------------I just ordered this WIFI TV before it actually was introduced on the market....something I never do....I am taking a chance, relying on Amazon's excellent return policy in case things do not work as advertised.I gave this item a four star rating only because I had to give it some rating in order to write this; and Samsung products usually achieve at least that rating.We were looking for a good 46 inch LCD, LED, NON 3-D TV with wireless WIFI built in and within our budget. We do a lot of streaming; but we consider 3-D in a home environment to be a fleeting fad. The reason for my writing this non-review is to provide the specifications for this TV, something Amazon has not done in its description.Here goes:FIRST the HYPEThis TV is no "boob tube"From its slim panel and ultra-thin bezel to its spider-leg pedestal stand, Samsung's UN46ES6100 tosses conventional TV thinking out the window. It offers a brilliant picture, but that's really only the beginning. This set has more on its mind, with a suite of Internet apps custom-built for TV use. Built-in Wi-Fi® connects effortlessly to your home's wireless network so you can surf the web or stream content from your computer, smartphone or tablet.A Smart TV with Smart ContentSamsung's latest Smart TVs give you new ways to access your favorite shows, movies, games and more, on the web and elsewhere. You'll find content providers like Netflix®, Hulu Plus(tm), ESPN ScoreCenter, and more. And a full web browser is included for convenient searching. And Samsung upgraded their AllShare(tm) networking feature so you can access your content from the cloud and even control other compatible devices.The right connections to be your digital entertainment hubTwo types of connections have become truly universal in recent years: HDMI and USB, and the UN46ES6100 has three of each. High-definition components like cable and satellite TV receivers look and sound their best via HDMI, and so do a growing number of digital cameras and camcorders. And the USB ports let you plug in a wide array of devices -- everything from a thumb drive to an optional webcam that's needed.NOW the FEATURES and the SPECS:45.9" screen (measured diagonally)tuner receives over-the-air HDTV broadcasts (antenna required)QAM cable TV tuner (subscription required to receive cable channels contact your local service provider for details)LED edge back light for high picture contrast5,000,000:1 dynamic contrast ratioClear Motion Rate 240 blur reduction (120Hz refresh rate plus back light scanning)Internet-ready Smart TV -- plays Netflix® video and more (broadband service required; subscription required for Netflix service)built-in Wi-Fi® to link to a wireless networkBUILT-IN WEB BROWSER ...(let's see how that works)AllShare(tm) video and music streaming from a DLNA-compatible Windows® PC***Skype(tm)-compatible (requires Samsung camera -- sold separately)built-in stereo speakers (10 watts x 2)remote controlAnynet+ simplifies control of compatible Samsung components via the HDMI connection (HDMI-CEC)meets ENERGY STAR® requirementspicture settings memory for each video input-------------------------------------------------Connections and Dimensions:4 A/V inputs, including:1 component video (selectable component/composite)3 HDMI v1.4RF input for antenna/cable signalsoptical digital audio output (would have been nice to have analog as well)Ethernet port for a high-speed connection to a home network3 USB ports for connecting a camera or thumb drivedetachable swivel standwall-mountable (bracket not included)41-7/8"W x 24-7/8"H x 1-1/4"D (27-5/8"H x 11"D on stand)weight: 32.4 lbs. with stand; 28.4 lbs. without standwarranty: 1 year parts & labor -- in-home service----------------------------------------------------------------If this TV delivers all that it claims, it might be the best deal on the market. We shall see. It will not be delivered until late March, after which I will provide an update.
